info.title: ManagementLinkClient
info.description: Azure resources can be linked together to form logical relationships. You can establish links between resources belonging to different resource groups. However, all the linked resources must belong to the same subscription. Each resource can be linked to 50 other resources. If any of the linked resources are deleted or moved, the link owner must clean up the remaining link.

get.description: Lists all of the available Microsoft.Resources REST API operations.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

get.description: Gets all the linked resources for the subscription.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: The filter to apply on the list resource links operation. The supported filter for list resource links is targetId. For example, $filter=targetId eq {value}

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.

200.description: Returns an array of resource links for the subscription.

get.description: Gets a resource link with the specified ID.

parameters.name: linkId
parameters.description: The fully qualified Id of the resource link. For example, /subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/resourceGroups/myGroup/Microsoft.Web/sites/mySite/Microsoft.Resources/links/myLink

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

200.description: OK - Returns information about the resource link.

put.description: Creates or updates a resource link between the specified resources.

parameters.name: linkId
parameters.description: The fully qualified ID of the resource link. Use the format, /subscriptions/{subscription-id}/resourceGroups/{resource-group-name}/{provider-namespace}/{resource-type}/{resource-name}/Microsoft.Resources/links/{link-name}. For example, /subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/resourceGroups/myGroup/Microsoft.Web/sites/mySite/Microsoft.Resources/links/myLink

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

requestBody.description: Parameters for creating or updating a resource link.

200.description: OK - Returns information about the link.

201.description: Created - Returns information about the link.

delete.description: Deletes a resource link with the specified ID.

parameters.name: linkId
parameters.description: The fully qualified ID of the resource link. Use the format, /subscriptions/{subscription-id}/resourceGroups/{resource-group-name}/{provider-namespace}/{resource-type}/{resource-name}/Microsoft.Resources/links/{link-name}. For example, /subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/resourceGroups/myGroup/Microsoft.Web/sites/mySite/Microsoft.Resources/links/myLink

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

get.description: Gets a list of resource links at and below the specified source scope.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The fully qualified ID of the scope for getting the resource links. For example, to list resource links at and under a resource group, set the scope to /subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/resourceGroups/myGroup.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: The filter to apply when getting resource links. To get links only at the specified scope (not below the scope), use Filter.atScope().

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for the operation.

200.description: OK - Returns an array of links at the specified scope.

operation.description: Operation type: Read, write, delete, etc.

resource.description: Resource on which the operation is performed: Profile, endpoint, etc.

display.description: The object that represents the operation.

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of operation list results if there are any.

OperationListResult.description: Result of the request to list Microsoft.Resources operations. It contains a list of operations and a URL link to get the next set of results.

id.description: The fully qualified ID of the resource link.

name.description: The name of the resource link.

targetId.description: The ID of the target resource.

sourceId.description: The fully qualified ID of the source resource in the link.

targetId.description: The fully qualified ID of the target resource in the link.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version
ApiVersionParameter.description: The API version to use for the operation.

SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionIdParameter.description: The ID of the target subscription.
